subject: Travel
title: Great Zimbabwe
description: A micro-lesson that makes Great Zimbabwe usable.

hook.text: Stone ruins in southern Africa baffled European colonizers. They refused to believe Africans built them.

buildup.text: Great Zimbabwe was a thriving trade city from the 1100s to the 1400s, with walls 36 feet high.

discovery.text: The city traded gold and ivory with merchants from Arabia, India, and China. Artifacts prove global connections.

twist.text: Colonial authorities claimed Phoenicians or Arabs built it. They suppressed evidence of African origin for decades.

climax.text: Modern archaeology confirmed the Shona people built it. Zimbabwe took its country name from these ruins.

punchline.text: They denied Africans built it. A whole country now bears its name.

quiz.question: Who built Great Zimbabwe?
options: The Shona people of southern Africa
